alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:11PM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... South Mayde Creek Near Greenhouse Road affecting Harris County. For the Addicks Reservoir...including Greenhouse Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Mayde Creek Near Greenhouse Road. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 109.0 feet, At levels above 109 feet moderate lowland flooding begins as Greenhouse Road north and south of the channel is inundated and numerous roads along the creek are inundated and impassable. Much of Cullen Park and Saums Road is also flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:05 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 108.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:05 PM CST Tuesday was 108.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage until further notice. - Flood stage is 107.9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CST.
